item.title: Per-session watermarking
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I finally got around to updating my script to cleanly record the parameters from the same page the jar is grabbed from, it is recorded in a file the same name with .properties on the end of it, because it is formated to be used in the java Properties class.

Such as:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/gamepack.jar.properties

The update of course broke my version checking, anyone mind fixing that for me? (a java program will do), or pointing me in the right direction?

Read full topic

item.title: Per-session watermarking
item.dc:creator: @_Rick1 _Rick
item.description:
@_Rick1 wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:57, topic:420811”]I just don’t understand how open source material that does not contain any of their code can be illicit. I could understand if you used their images, algorithms and such however usually it is not the case.

Also ClusterFlutter isn’t as difficult to break as they made out, the only problem now is that you need to run the updater on each load to grab the new fields and their unique key, I can already print out npc and player information from using the AES decrypter someone posted earlier to decrypt the classes, inject and swap back in with a custom loader. The hardest part was probably getting the custom loader to actually work and not piss loads of runtime errors at me.

But I am almost debating, because of the law issues and that text file they now issue with the game pack to avoid hacking the client directly and using colour and edge detection, the only problem is that it is then limited as you cannot do things such as “world walk”, the only way I could think of combating it is to save a low res image of the whole minimap, split into areas like rs does, pinpoint your location by detecting close objects and similarities then to convert that to a tile location and walk using it, but then you run the problems of ladders, doors and walls.[/quote]

Using visual data to bot on games really does not limit your capabilities, it just makes it a bit harder and it requires alot more imagination then being able to rip stuff straight from a game client to base your functionality on. In the end you will end up using several algorithms for edge detection, color filtering/heatmap generation and such. If you have read my topic on RS-Hacking you will see some of the theories i applied to make an application like this and how it all works, but I assume you have a pretty good idea of how it works already.

Read full topic

item.title: Per-session watermarking
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I just don’t understand how open source material that does not contain any of their code can be illicit. I could understand if you used their images, algorithms and such however usually it is not the case.

Also ClusterFlutter isn’t as difficult to break as they made out, the only problem now is that you need to run the updater on each load to grab the new fields and their unique key, I can already print out npc and player information from using the AES decrypter someone posted earlier to decrypt the classes, inject and swap back in with a custom loader. The hardest part was probably getting the custom loader to actually work and not piss loads of runtime errors at me.

But I am almost debating, because of the law issues and that text file they now issue with the game pack to avoid hacking the client directly and using colour and edge detection, the only problem is that it is then limited as you cannot do things such as “world walk”, the only way I could think of combating it is to save a low res image of the whole minimap, split into areas like rs does, pinpoint your location by detecting close objects and similarities then to convert that to a tile location and walk using it, but then you run the problems of ladders, doors and walls.

Read full topic

item.title: Per-session watermarking
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

In the EU, they would have the demonstrate that the encryption is an anti copyright breach device. Since the game is freely copyable anyway, how do you prove that it’s an anti copyright device and not an anti reverse engineering device (which is legal to circumvent). IANAL, but it seems like a pretty hard thing to do. Blizzard had trouble (though ultimately succeeded, I think)

It does piss me off that a company can openly abuse laws to make legal things legally challenging.

Read full topic

item.title: Per-session watermarking
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:

[quote=“frank_, post:53, topic:420811”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=523485.msg3817029#msg3817029 date=1321429863]
[/quote]there may or may not have been a hint of sarcasm in my post ^^

if you want people to develop stuff and release it on this site, you might consider spending some of your server money on a lawyer just to confirm what exactly we can and cannot do[/quote]

It wasn’t aimed at just you either, also I saw an IRC snippet where Speljohan said ‘we are done’ as well.

That’s actually not a bad idea, the trouble might be finding a lawyer that knows what he is doing in the software world around here. I’ll see what I can do.

Read full topic

item.title: Per-session watermarking
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:51, topic:420811”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=523485.msg3816346#msg3816346 date=1321385312]

[quote]IMPORTANT LEGAL NOTICE – PLEASE READ

YOU ARE STRONGLY ENCOURAGED TO READ THIS STATEMENT, ALL TERMS, POLICIES AND AGREEMENTS OF JAGEX LIMITED AND TO ACT IN ACCORDANCE WITH SUCH MATERIALS AS WELL AS ALL APPLICABLE LAWS.

This software is Copyright © Jagex Limited, 1999-2011. All rights reserved.

Jagex®, RuneScape® and the Jagex Logo are registered and unregistered trademarks and trade names of Jagex Limited, registered and/or used in the United Kingdom, European Union and United States of America as well as other countries.

THIS SOFTWARE IS ENCRYPTED AND ANY ATTEMPT BY YOU TO BREAK OR CIRCUMVENT THIS ENCRYPTION OR OTHERWISE INTERFERE WITH OR DISRUPT JAGEX LIMITED’S LEGITIMATE OPERATION OF ITS SERVICES AND GAMES MAY BE A VIOLATION OF CIVIL AND/OR CRIMINAL LAWS.

ANY REPRODUCTION, REDISTRIBUTION, OR MISUSE OF RUNESCAPE (OR ANY OTHER JAGEX LIMITED GAME) OR ANY SOFTWARE OF JAGEX LIMITED OR ANY USE OF THE FOREGOING OTHER THAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANY POLICY, AGREEMENT OR THE TERMS OF JAGEX LIMITED, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS, PRIVACY POLICY AND RULES PERTAINING TO RUNESCAPE (OR ANY JAGEX LIMITED GAME) IS EXPRESSLY PROHIBITED BY LAW, AND MAY RESULT IN SERIOUS CIVIL AND/OR CRIMINAL PENALTIES.
[/quote]thats it guys, we’re done

edit: the jar size is reasonable now, so maybe they lowered their level of encryption… or compressed the shit out of it
[/quote][quote author=frank_ link=topic=523485.msg3816396#msg3816396 date=1321388101]

where did you pull that notice as i cannot find it.
[/quote]Software_Disclaimer.txt in the gamepack jar

They could have just as easily said the same thing about the jar file format:

THIS SOFTWARE IS ENCRYPTED COMPRESSED AND ANY ATTEMPT BY YOU TO BREAK OR CIRCUMVENT THIS ENCRYPTION COMPRESSION OR OTHERWISE INTERFERE WITH OR DISRUPT JAGEX LIMITED’S LEGITIMATE OPERATION OF ITS SERVICES AND GAMES MAY BE A VIOLATION OF CIVIL AND/OR CRIMINAL LAWS.

And it doesn’t make it any more or less legal to run transforms on their code than it was before. I see no reason whatsoever that would lead me to believe ‘we are done’. Jagex’s TOS has said for years that cheating on their game was illegal, bla bla bla, and of course they would like that to be true, thankfully they don’t run any legal system that I’m aware of and have to abide by (somewhat) sane laws like the rest of us.

I’ll update my getRS.sh script to handle this new crap within a couple of days, if anyone else wants to have a go at it before then, be my guest.

edit:
Notice how they say ‘MAY BE’, not ‘WILL BE’, because it won’t.[/quote]Pretty sure that Encryption is covered somewhere in some computer laws though, otherwise there would be no reason for Jagex to do this.

Read full topic

Jagex®, RuneScape® and the Jagex Logo are registered and unregistered trademarks and trade names of Jagex Limited, registered and/or used in the United Kingdom, European Union and United States of America as well as other countries.

THIS SOFTWARE IS ENCRYPTED AND ANY ATTEMPT BY YOU TO BREAK OR CIRCUMVENT THIS ENCRYPTION OR OTHERWISE INTERFERE WITH OR DISRUPT JAGEX LIMITED’S LEGITIMATE OPERATION OF ITS SERVICES AND GAMES MAY BE A VIOLATION OF CIVIL AND/OR CRIMINAL LAWS.

ANY REPRODUCTION, REDISTRIBUTION, OR MISUSE OF RUNESCAPE (OR ANY OTHER JAGEX LIMITED GAME) OR ANY SOFTWARE OF JAGEX LIMITED OR ANY USE OF THE FOREGOING OTHER THAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANY POLICY, AGREEMENT OR THE TERMS OF JAGEX LIMITED, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS, PRIVACY POLICY AND RULES PERTAINING TO RUNESCAPE (OR ANY JAGEX LIMITED GAME) IS EXPRESSLY PROHIBITED BY LAW, AND MAY RESULT IN SERIOUS CIVIL AND/OR CRIMINAL PENALTIES.
[/quote]thats it guys, we’re done

edit: the jar size is reasonable now, so maybe they lowered their level of encryption… or compressed the shit out of it[/quote][quote=“frank_, post:48, topic:420811”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=523485.msg3816376#msg3816376 date=1321387420]
where did you pull that notice as i cannot find it.
[/quote]Software_Disclaimer.txt in the gamepack jar[/quote]

They could have just as easily said the same thing about the jar file format:

THIS SOFTWARE IS [s]ENCRYPTED[/s] COMPRESSED AND ANY ATTEMPT BY YOU TO BREAK OR CIRCUMVENT THIS [s]ENCRYPTION[/s] COMPRESSION OR OTHERWISE INTERFERE WITH OR DISRUPT JAGEX LIMITED’S LEGITIMATE OPERATION OF ITS SERVICES AND GAMES MAY BE A VIOLATION OF CIVIL AND/OR CRIMINAL LAWS.

And it doesn’t make it any more or less legal to run transforms on their code than it was before. I see no reason whatsoever that would lead me to believe ‘we are done’. Jagex’s TOS has said for years that cheating on their game was illegal, bla bla bla, and of course they would like that to be true, thankfully they don’t run any legal system that I’m aware of and have to abide by (somewhat) sane laws like the rest of us.

I’ll update my getRS.sh script to handle this new crap within a couple of days, if anyone else wants to have a go at it before then, be my guest.

edit:
Notice how they say ‘MAY BE’, not ‘WILL BE’, because it won’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Per-session watermarking
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

This will get you session specific gamepacks

[code] private static Pattern session_pattern = Pattern.compile(“src=”(.)" w");
private static Pattern archive_pattern = Pattern.compile("archive=(.)\s+code=(.) m");
private static Pattern param_pattern = Pattern.compile("<param name="([^\s]+)"\s+value="([^>])">");

GameLoader() {
    AppletLoaderContext context = new AppletLoaderContext();
    try {
        String gamePage = read("http://www.runescape.com/game.ws?j=0");
        Matcher session = session_pattern.matcher(gamePage);
        if(session.find()) {
            String gameFrameURL = session.group(1).trim();
            System.out.println(gameFrameURL.substring(0, gameFrameURL.indexOf("/,")));
            context.setDocumentBase(new URL(gameFrameURL.substring(0, gameFrameURL.indexOf("/,"))));
            context.setCodeBase(new URL(gameFrameURL.substring(0, gameFrameURL.indexOf("/,"))));
            String gameFrame = read(gameFrameURL);
            Matcher archive = archive_pattern.matcher(gameFrame);
            if(archive.find()) {
                String jar = archive.group(1);
                String code = archive.group(2);
                Matcher param = param_pattern.matcher(gameFrame);
                while (param.find())
                if (context.getParameter(param.group(1)) == null) {
                    context.putParameter(param.group(1), param.group(2));
                }

                game = new AppletLoader(jar, code, context);
            }
        }
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }

}
/**
 * loads html page source
 * @param address the url to load
 * @return html source code of address
 * @throws IOException
 */
private String read(String address) throws IOException {
    URL url = new URL(address);
    BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(url.openStream()));
    String inputLine;
    StringBuilder outputLine = new StringBuilder();
    while ((inputLine = in.readLine()) != null) {
        outputLine.append(inputLine).append("\n");
    }
    in.close();
    return outputLine.toString();
}[/code]

edit:

use a custom class loader to load the applet, hack the classloader class using your custom class loader by decrypting the files using the method already posted on this forum and you can now inject and swap in your own classes

Read full topic

item.title: Per-session watermarking
item.dc:creator: @CheatoX CheatoX
item.description:
@CheatoX wrote:

I noticed that iagex implemented a new loader system in rs. The jar file is grabbed from the server. The jar contains the loader and an encrypted ‘inner.pack.gz’ file which contains the rs classes. To decrypt the file you need the ‘0’ parameter value and the ‘-1’ parameter value. The first one is the ‘key’ used to decypher the file and the second is the ivParameterSpec.

So if you want to get the rs classes you need to get those 2 parameters including the gamepack which coresponds with those parameters. Don’t use another gamepack.jar file from them with the 2 parameters from another rs instance as it won’t work.

Main.java:

[code]package com.rubodev;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.jar.JarEntry;
import java.util.jar.JarOutputStream;

/**

  • Created by IntelliJ IDEA.

  • User: Vincent

  • Date: 15/11/11

  • Time: 19:45

  • To change this template use File | Settings | File Templates.
    */
    public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
    HashMap<String,byte[]> classes = Utils.decryptPack(“parameter ‘0’ value”,“parameter ‘-1’ value”);
    JarOutputStream jos = new JarOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(new File(“dumpedJar.jar”)));
    for(String key : classes.keySet()){
    byte[] bytes = classes.get(key);
    System.out.println(key+" -> “+bytes.length+” bytes" );
    jos.putNextEntry(new JarEntry(key.replaceAll("\.", “/”) + “.class”));
    jos.write(bytes);
    jos.closeEntry();

     }
 jos.close();

    }
    }
    [/code]

Utils.java:

[code]package com.rubodev;

import javax.crypto.BadPaddingException;
import javax.crypto.Cipher;
import javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException;
import javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException;
import javax.crypto.spec.IvParameterSpec;
import javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec;
import java.io.;
import java.security.;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.jar.JarEntry;
import java.util.jar.JarInputStream;
import java.util.jar.JarOutputStream;
import java.util.jar.Pack200;
import java.util.zip.GZIPInputStream;

/**

  • Created by IntelliJ IDEA.

  • User: Vincent

  • Date: 15/11/11

  • Time: 19:46

  • To change this template use File | Settings | File Templates.
    */
    public class Utils {
    static byte[] decrypt(String arg0) throws Exception {
    int j1 = 0;
    int i;
    int j;
    int k;
    int l;
    byte[] abyte0;
    char c1;
    int i1;
    char c2;
    try {
    i = arg0.length();
    if (0 == i)
    return new byte[0];
    } catch (RuntimeException runtimeexception) {
    throw new Exception("");
    }
    label0:
    {
    label1:
    {
    label2:
    {
    label3:
    {
    label4:
    {
    j = -4 & i + 3;
    k = 3 * (j / 4);
    if (~i >= ~(-2 + j))
    break label1;
    c1 = arg0.charAt(j - 2);
    if (’\0’ <= c1 && c1 < p.length) {
    l = p[c1];
    if (j1 == 0)
    break label4;
    }
    l = -1;
    }
    if (~l == 0)
    break label1;
    if (i <= j - 1)
    break label2;
    c2 = arg0.charAt(-1 + j);
    if (~c2 <= -1 && ~p.length < ~c2) {
    i1 = p[c2];
    if (j1 == 0)
    break label3;
    }
    i1 = -1;
    }
    if (0 != ~i1 && j1 == 0)
    break label0;
    }
    k–;
    if (j1 == 0)
    break label0;
    }
    k -= 2;
    }
    abyte0 = new byte[k];
    decrypt2(abyte0, 0, arg0, (byte) -75);
    return abyte0;
    }

    static int decrypt2(byte[] arg0, int arg1, String arg2, byte arg3) throws Exception {
    int var17 = 0;

     try {
     int var4 = arg1;
     int var5 = arg2.length();
     int var6 = 0;

     int var10000;
     while (true) {
         if (var5 > var6) {
             char var8 = arg2.charAt(var6);
             var10000 = var8;
             if (var17 != 0) {
                 break;
             }

             int var7;
             label128:
             {
                 if (var8 >= 0 && ~p.length < ~var8) {
                     var7 = p[var8];
                     if (var17 == 0) {
                         break label128;
                     }
                 }

                 var7 = -1;
             }

             int var10;
             label140:
             {
                 if (var5 <= 1 + var6) {
                     var10 = -1;
                     if (var17 == 0) {
                         break label140;
                     }
                 }

                 int var11;
                 label117:
                 {
                     char var12 = arg2.charAt(var6 + 1);
                     if (0 <= var12 && var12 < p.length) {
                         var11 = p[var12];
                         if (var17 == 0) {
                             break label117;
                         }
                     }

                     var11 = -1;
                 }

                 var10 = var11;
             }

             int var19;
             label141:
             {
                 if (~(2 + var6) <= ~var5) {
                     var19 = -1;
                     if (var17 == 0) {
                         break label141;
                     }
                 }

                 int var13;
                 label106:
                 {
                     char var14 = arg2.charAt(2 + var6);
                     if (0 <= var14 && p.length > var14) {
                         var13 = p[var14];
                         if (var17 == 0) {
                             break label106;
                         }
                     }

                     var13 = -1;
                 }

                 var19 = var13;
             }

             int var20;
             label142:
             {
                 if (3 + var6 >= var5) {
                     var20 = -1;
                     if (var17 == 0) {
                         break label142;
                     }
                 }

                 int var15;
                 label95:
                 {
                     char var16 = arg2.charAt(3 + var6);
                     if (0 <= var16 && ~var16 > ~p.length) {
                         var15 = p[var16];
                         if (var17 == 0) {
                             break label95;
                         }
                     }

                     var15 = -1;
                 }

                 var20 = var15;
             }

             arg0[arg1++] = (byte) (var7 << 2 | var10 >>> 4);
             if (var19 != -1 || var17 != 0) {
                 arg0[arg1++] = (byte) (var19 >>> 2 | 240 & var10 << 4);
                 if (~var20 != 0) {
                     arg0[arg1++] = (byte) (var20 | var19 << 6 & 192);
                     var6 += 4;
                     if (var17 == 0) {
                         continue;
                     }
                 }
             }
         }

         var10000 = arg3;
         break;
     }

     return var10000 > -45 ? 45 : arg1 + -var4;
 } catch (RuntimeException var18) {
     throw new Exception("");

 }

    }

    public static HashMap<String, byte[]> decryptPack(String variable1, String variable2) {
    int dummy = 0;
    HashMap<String, byte[]> classes = new HashMap<String, byte[]>();
    try {
    byte[] key = decrypt(variable1);
    byte[] ivParameterSpec = decrypt(variable2);
    Cipher cipherObject;
    SecretKeySpec secretKeySpec = new SecretKeySpec(key, “AES”);

         try {
         cipherObject = Cipher.getInstance("AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding");
         (cipherObject).init(2, secretKeySpec, new IvParameterSpec(ivParameterSpec));
     } catch (NoSuchPaddingException var34) {
         throw new RuntimeException(var34);
     } catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException var35) {
         throw new RuntimeException(var35);
     } catch (InvalidKeyException var36) {
         throw new RuntimeException(var36);
     } catch (InvalidAlgorithmParameterException var37) {
         throw new RuntimeException(var37);
     }

     InputStream packStream = new FileInputStream(new File("inner.pack.gz"));
     if (packStream == null) {

         System.exit(1);
     }

     byte[] buffer = new byte[5242880];
     int offset = 0;

     int bytesread;
     try {
         int bytesRead = packStream.read(buffer, offset, 5242880 - offset);

         while (-1 != bytesRead) {
             offset += bytesRead;
             bytesRead = packStream.read(buffer, offset, -offset + 5242880);
             bytesread = dummy;

             if (bytesread != 0 || dummy != 0) {
                 break;
             }
         }
     } catch (IOException var44) {
         var44.printStackTrace();
     }

     byte[] dest = new byte[offset];
     System.arraycopy(buffer, 0, dest, 0, offset);
     byte[] decryptedData = null;

     try {
         decryptedData = cipherObject.doFinal(dest);
     } catch (BadPaddingException var32) {
         var32.printStackTrace();
     } catch (IllegalBlockSizeException var33) {
         var33.printStackTrace();
     }
     Pack200.Unpacker unpacker = Pack200.newUnpacker();
     ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream(5242880);

     try {
         JarOutputStream jos = new JarOutputStream(bos);
         GZIPInputStream gzip = new GZIPInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(decryptedData));
         unpacker.unpack(gzip, jos);
         jos.close();
     } catch (IOException var31) {
         var31.printStackTrace();
     }


     label191:
     {
         try {
             JarInputStream jarInputStream = new JarInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(bos.toByteArray()));

             JarEntry entry;
             while ((entry = jarInputStream.getNextJarEntry()) != null) {
                 String entryName = entry.getName();
                 offset = 0;
                 bytesread = jarInputStream.read(buffer, offset, 5242880 + -offset);
                 if (dummy != 0) {
                     break label191;
                 }

                 int bytesRead1 = bytesread;

                 label143:
                 {
                     while (true) {
                         if (0 != ~bytesRead1) {
                             offset += bytesRead1;
                             bytesRead1 = jarInputStream.read(buffer, offset, -offset + 5242880);
                             bytesread = dummy;

                             if (bytesread != 0) {
                                 break;
                             }

                             if (dummy == 0) {
                                 continue;
                             }
                         }

                         if (!entryName.endsWith(".class")) {
                             break label143;
                         }

                         entryName = entryName.replace('/', '.');
                         break;
                     }

                     byte[] desBytes = new byte[offset];
                     System.arraycopy(buffer, 0, desBytes, 0, offset);
                     classes.put(entryName.substring(0, entryName.length() + -6), desBytes);
                 }

                 if (dummy != 0) {
                     break;
                 }
             }
         } catch (IOException e) {
             e.printStackTrace();
         }


     }

 } catch (Exception e) {
     e.printStackTrace();
 }
 return classes;

    }

    static int[] p;
    private static char[] m;

    static {
    label0:
    {
    p = new int[128];
    int i1 = 0;
    while (~i1 > ~p.length) {
    p[i1] = -1;
    i1++;
    }
    break label0;

     }
 label1:
 {
     int j1 = 65;
     while (-91 <= ~j1) {
         p[j1] = -65 + j1;
         j1++;
     }
     break label1;
 }
 label2:
 {
     int k1 = 97;
     while (122 >= k1) {
         p[k1] = k1 + -71;
         k1++;
     }
     break label2;
 }
 label3:
 {
     int l1 = 48;
     while (-58 <= ~l1) {
         p[l1] = (-48 + l1) - -52;
         l1++;
     }
     break label3;
 }
 label4:
 {
     p[43] = 62;
     int ai[] = p;
     ai[42] = 62;
     p[47] = 63;
     int ai1[] = p;
     ai1[45] = 63;
     m = new char[64];
     int i2 = 0;
     while (26 > i2) {
         m[i2] = (char) (65 + i2);
         i2++;
     }
     break label4;
 }
 label5:
 {
     int j2 = 26;
     while (~j2 > -53) {
         m[j2] = (char) (-26 + (97 - -j2));
         j2++;
     }
     break label5;
 }
 label6:
 {
     int k2 = 52;
     while (k2 < 62) {
         m[k2] = (char) (-52 + k2 + 48);
         k2++;
     }
     break label6;
 }
 m[63] = '/';
 m[62] = '+';

    }

    static {
    label0:
    {
    p = new int[128];
    int i1 = 0;
    while (~i1 > ~p.length) {
    p[i1] = -1;
    i1++;
    }
    break label0;
    }
    label1:
    {
    int j1 = 65;
    while (-91 <= ~j1) {
    p[j1] = -65 + j1;
    j1++;
    }
    break label1;
    }
    label2:
    {
    int k1 = 97;
    while (122 >= k1) {
    p[k1] = k1 + -71;
    k1++;
    }
    break label2;
    }
    label3:
    {
    int l1 = 48;
    while (-58 <= ~l1) {
    p[l1] = (-48 + l1) - -52;
    l1++;
    }
    break label3;
    }
    label4:
    {
    p[43] = 62;
    int ai[] = p;
    ai[42] = 62;

    m = new char[64];

    i2++;

    label5:

    }
    label6:

    while (k2 < 62) {

    k2++;
    }
    break label6;
    }
    m[63] = ‘/’;
    m[62] = ‘+’;
    }
    }
    [/code]

I’m sorry for the bad naming. Parts of new loader code has been used to produce this

item.title: Per-session watermarking
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

IMPORTANT LEGAL NOTICE – PLEASE READ

YOU ARE STRONGLY ENCOURAGED TO READ THIS STATEMENT, ALL TERMS, POLICIES AND AGREEMENTS OF JAGEX LIMITED AND TO ACT IN ACCORDANCE WITH SUCH MATERIALS AS WELL AS ALL APPLICABLE LAWS.

This software is Copyright © Jagex Limited, 1999-2011. All rights reserved.

Jagex®, RuneScape® and the Jagex Logo are registered and unregistered trademarks and trade names of Jagex Limited, registered and/or used in the United Kingdom, European Union and United States of America as well as other countries.

THIS SOFTWARE IS ENCRYPTED AND ANY ATTEMPT BY YOU TO BREAK OR CIRCUMVENT THIS ENCRYPTION OR OTHERWISE INTERFERE WITH OR DISRUPT JAGEX LIMITED’S LEGITIMATE OPERATION OF ITS SERVICES AND GAMES MAY BE A VIOLATION OF CIVIL AND/OR CRIMINAL LAWS.

ANY REPRODUCTION, REDISTRIBUTION, OR MISUSE OF RUNESCAPE (OR ANY OTHER JAGEX LIMITED GAME) OR ANY SOFTWARE OF JAGEX LIMITED OR ANY USE OF THE FOREGOING OTHER THAN IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANY POLICY, AGREEMENT OR THE TERMS OF JAGEX LIMITED, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS, PRIVACY POLICY AND RULES PERTAINING TO RUNESCAPE (OR ANY JAGEX LIMITED GAME) IS EXPRESSLY PROHIBITED BY LAW, AND MAY RESULT IN SERIOUS CIVIL AND/OR CRIMINAL PENALTIES.

thats it guys, we’re done

edit: the jar size is reasonable now, so maybe they lowered their level of encryption… or compressed the shit out of it

item.title: Per-session watermarking
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

frank_:

needs more samples

Give me access to more IPs to wget from and I can host all the samples you like.

[quote=“b0nethugs, post:36, topic:420811”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=523485.msg3814425#msg3814425 date=1321205715]

[quote author=b0nethugs link=topic=523485.msg3813576#msg3813576 date=1321136441]

Oh shit, I just got a PM from a member that wishes to remain anonymous, but he is right. The jar’s you recieve are NOT country-based, they are based on your particular IP address. I confirmed this to be true because the jar I get when I download it from my home IP looks like this:

679 update of gamepack.jar occured 11-11-12_14 md5sum: 75f0e053620ae65daeacc19e7cba42f9

While the one downloaded also from the USA but from my server in chicago looks like this:

679 update of gamepack.jar occured 11-11-11_10 md5sum: 742addcc5b970172f3513afdc2aed8c4

So now what?
[/quote]On your outprint of this can you make a new file with the parameters of each one you get? Because we can still fake the parameters and login using a UK US etc even if you are not there… Just for testing.

Thanks.

I doubt just grabbing them with the same string works, I can test it out though.
[/quote]Aye it does work… The bot I am currently making is a shared project between me (UK) and my mate (Lithuania) He changed his parameters to the UK one so where both working off the same client for testing and it worked perfect.[/quote]

That’s incredibly stupid on jagex’s part, but sure, I’ll start logging the file names as well I guess.

Read full topic
